answers.answer: I would talk to her. The worst thing she could say is no. But you won't know till you ask! Good luck girly I hope the next few weeks fly by for you :)

It's a miracle you've come this far from your previous experiences. I would ask your doctor, but also take it week by week. You may get thru the rough patch of pain and decide you're able to go full term, or you could get into even more pain. With what you're experiencing I don't think it'd be a bad thing to do.

I really empathise with you. I'm 32wks and have been on bedrest most of this pregnancy, I'm very uncomfortable with battling preterm labour, and we were never expected to get past 24wks after I developed preeclamplsia at just 15wks but meds and rest has got us this far. If baby can stay in for another 4wks my dr is doing a csection at right on 36wks because he doesn't want my bp rising any further. He's doing it for baby's sake not mine tho and we will need our peadiatrician and nicu team there at delivery as lungs are still under developed at 36wks but my first was born at 35wks for the same reasons and only needed 1wk nicu so I'm hoping it will be about the same if not less at 36wks. I believe statistics for survival and long term outcomes are better at/after the 37wk milestone. Maybe your dr would be more willing to consider 37wks? I guess you can only ask. I hope the rest of your pregnancy goes smoothly.
You could ask him what the plan is, how long they are trying to keep you pregnant. What is the reason for the bed rest? Sometimes they will deliver or induce early for specific reasons.

For the most part I don't think your doctor will induce that early because of the risks of having a preterm baby. But honestly if you went it labor naturally I doubt your doctor would stop the labor. Good luck!
Most drs wont induce until after 39 weeks but with you being so small and your situation maybe she'll do it
Doesn't hurt to ask mama. The doctor might take a look at your situation and decide it's better to induce a bit early. I'd say they probably wait till at least 37 weeks, but I'd ask in your postion.

37 weeks is considered the safe early delivery date. Rarely will the pull a baby at 36 weeks and anything before that is considered an emergency delivery. Ask your doctor about it also make sure that you are bog enoigh to deliver naturally. You sound very small. Tell your doctor you want a tentative delivery plan so you can mentally prepare.
If you are that tiny your body will probably kick that baby out a little early by itself.

Honestly im kinda surprised ur doc hasnt mentioned inducing you a lil early n i can emphasize with u as i am 5'1 and am only 22 weeks n my backpain is absolutely horrible thus far so i would definitely ask i would think it wouldnt b a problem as long as ur lil one is healthy .... good luck mama

Like others say, talk with your doc...they may already have an early induction planned in your case! :-) I do think they prob will lean towards 37 weeks rather than 36 unless baby is in distress. I'm 37 weeks and no complications and am SO wishing my lil one could come now! I def have to wait a few more weeks though.

I'm on Bedrest cause I started having contractions at 29-30W.. He gave me some kind of medication to take daily and said to take it easy.. But he does have me going in every week to monitor my contractions.And I know I'm still early and I want my daughter to be healthy and Ohkay.But OMG... I've been in so much pain , I Feel like I'm being squished inside .. and for my back he sent me to a chiropractor cause my back and hips were off. Like by an 1nch! And I quit going cause there wasn't much he could do cause I was Preqnant and cause I had problems in Early pregnancy with the Bleedinq.I started having problems at 10w , I was having unexplainable heavy bleeding. It finally stopped around 16-18w.. Then at 29-30 I started contracting. So I mean it hasn't been easy ....
I just don't think your body size has anything to do with it. I'm 5 foot and normally about 97 pounds and carried twins to almost 37 wks without complications. Think it's more to do with other things
I'm being induced at 37 weeks but I'm also admitted till then.. I'm 36/1 now. I have preeclampsia

question: I know some are gonna say quit being selfish, you aren't full term and etc... And honestly if that's Somethinq your gonna say don't even bother commenting!Let me begin by saying I'm 33W.. I've lost my plug, I've been contracting, my cervix is soft, but I'm not dilating . My dr did say she's gonna come early.I've been a high risk pregnancy since day 1.I'm only 4'10, my dr says I am to lil for the Baby.And I have miscarried before, this is the farthest I've made it and I'm so very thankful!!But however... I have been having Extremly bad back pain! It feels like my backs locking up and I can't move. Her movement has gotten very painful for me, and half the time I'm short on breath cause I feel like she's squeezing me in the Inside. I've been on Bedrest and been Doinq everything I'm told.. I was just wondering if I talked to my dr and everything is good with her if I'd Beable to get induced ?
title: Can I ask to get induced at 36/37W ?
